entry.title: The Unknown Racist Origin of PROM | Dark History: CLIP

media:group.media:title: The Unknown Racist Origin of PROM | Dark History: CLIP
media:group.media:description:
Prom, originating from the word "Promenade," began at colleges in the late 19th century. However, by the time they reached American high schools, they took on a lowkey racist undertone...which unfortunately, Brown vs. Board of Education couldn't even stop.
I appreciate you for coming by, and tune in next week for more Dark History.

Hi friends, happy Thursday!
Some of us loved Prom. Some of us thought it was stupid. Some of us didn’t even go. But why do we even do it? And when did Prom start? Turns out… the roots of this high school tradition goes back centuries and involves something *VERY* controversial. This is the Dark History of… Debutante Balls & Prom.
I appreciate you for coming by, and tune in tomorrow for more Dark History.

entry.title: Bridgerton was real?! The Origin story of Debutante Balls | Dark History: CLIP

media:group.media:title: Bridgerton was real?! The Origin story of Debutante Balls | Dark History: CLIP
media:group.media:description:
Debutante balls started all the way back in the 1700s...at Queen Charlotte's birthday party! While Netflix & Shonda Rhimes may have taken some creative liberties with "Bridgerton," the social season, presenting oneself to the King & Queen, and even the dance cards were VERY real. And they inspired the balls and high school proms of today.
I appreciate you for coming by, and tune in next week for more Dark History.

Hi friends, happy Thursday!
Gossip has played a *VERY* important role throughout history. It brings us together and makes us feel like we know our favorite celebrities or people in power, but it can also tear us apart. But who paved the way for gossip to be what it is today? Well, this is the Dark History of Gossip.

entry.title: Discovering the world's earliest gossip columns! | Dark History: CLIP

media:group.media:title: Discovering the world's earliest gossip columns! | Dark History: CLIP
media:group.media:description:
Imagine being an archaeologist, discovering a stone tablet, and translating it just to find out that it was some juicy goss? As far back as writing has existed, gossip has been around...but sitting around and carving gossip into stone is a whole nother level of commitment.
